DialogueOption.Text: I'm headed for the Eye of the Universe. The time loop had to be shut down, though.
I'm headed for the Eye of the Universe. The time loop had to be shut down, though.
I'm headed for the Eye of the Universe.
I shut off the time loop.
I shut off the time loop. This is the core.
I'm turning the time loop off again.
Wanna hear about the most horrifying ways I've died so far?
Interested in hearing about more of my many terrible deaths?

Dialogue.Page: Got anything else?

DialogueOption.Text: I melted in the lava of Hollow's Lantern.
I got crushed by rising sand on Ember Twin.
I got crushed under the elevator to the launch platform.
I drowned.
I forgot to put on my space suit and immediately choked to death.
I ran out of oxygen.
I got electrocuted by the core of Giant's Deep.
I got eaten by an anglerfish.
I died to ghost matter. It was not fun.
My ship's autopilot sent me directly into the sun.
I died inside of the Ash Twin Project.
I tried using a weird lantern artifact on the Stranger, but it blew me up.
I tried using a prototype artifact on the Stranger, but it blew me up.
One of those alien guys in the dream world snapped my neck!
I actually managed to survive after the supernova, but I still got sent back in time.
Not at the moment, no.

Dialogue.Page: You know it, buddy! Lay 'em on me.
Really now? How'd it feel? I imagine it's like dying to the supernova, only more... liquidy.

DialogueOption.Text: It felt like being boiled in a big pot of sap soup.
It felt like if fire was a liquid.
I was too busy burning to death to really stop and smell the flowers, to be honest.

Dialogue.Page: Cool! I'd love to try it.
Ah well, still sounds fun!
Yeowch! Hard pass on that one. I can't stand headaches. Even a tiny one can make it impossible to think.
Oh geez, could you imagine being stuck in a time loop with a headache the entire time?! We're lucky. We're so lucky we don't. I hadn't even considered that.
Ha! Oh my gosh. Sorry for laughing, that's just... really funny.
Imagine the look on Slate's face! Everything they'd planned, then... splat! Flat as a sheet!
They'd be so freaked out, and they'd... well, probably cry a bunch and tell Hornfels what happened and...
Hmm, alright, maybe it's not actually that funny. Wow, who knew death could be such a morbid topic?
A classic way to go, eh?
Honestly, it sucks to think about. I mean, we have gills, but they're all... what's the word... vestigial? They close up after you're a newhatch.
Gosh, what am I saying? You already knew that. Obviously.
Wow! That's pretty much the one thing you never want to forget, buddy!
It's a wonder we're in a time loop, otherwise... wow, that'd be quite the way to go.
Hopefully that's the kind of mistake you only make once, eh?
Jeez. Yeah, that's rough, buddy.
I've been telling Slate over and over again: you have got to figure out a way to give the suits more air capacity. 6 minutes is not enough!

But they always say: "Oh, Gabbro, just go back to your ship!" Well what if my ship is floating off in the water and I can't get to it? What if I'm down in some winding cave system, huh? I mean, seriously, what kind of exploration do they expect us to do in 6 minutes?!
Ah, sorry for my little rant there. Going back to your ship probably is the right thing to do. It's annoying, but it's the right thing to do.

It's electric, huh? Maybe that has something to do with all the jellyfish down there. That could be like their nest or something, and the electric field is for deterring predators. Only they can get in and out.
Just a theory, though.
Eugh. Hard pass. Not into being eaten, not at all.
I guess those things are still kind of cool. Just... cool from a distance, y'know?
Honestly, I'm not too interested. It'd probably just be like dying in the supernova but slower.
Remember when Tektite was always shouting at everyone who got anywhere near that ghost matter pit in the village? That was great.
Ooh, yeah. That happens. Did nobody tell you to watch out for that? That's like, a really big thing they should've mentioned!

In case nobody's told you yet, the autopilot doesn't know if there's something between you and your destination. Planet, sun, Hollow's Lantern, whatever it may be, it's basically invisible to the thing.

So! Two tips: one, before engaging autopilot, make sure that the sun isn't directly or even indirectly between you and your destination; and two, only engage autopilot after takeoff, otherwise you might slam yourself right back into the ground and damage your landing gear.
...Huh. Look at me, giving out salient advice! And they said I'd never do it! Eat my pants, Hornfels!
Oh? ...What about that was interesting?

DialogueOption.Text: While I was inside it, I survived the supernova for a little while. It broke open eventually, but it was beautiful.

Dialogue.Page: Wow. That does sound cool, yeah!
Surviving the supernova... what on Hearth did they build that thing out of?
Whoa! What, was it like, some kind of weapon? Maybe it's faulty?
I can't imagine what a lantern that explodes when you light it could possibly by used for... whoever invented that must've been the Stranger's Feldspar!
Whoa! I guess our two species aren't actually that different, huh? A lot of our prototypes blew up too!
Wow! That is cold!
They must really not like outsiders. I mean, it's not like they actually snapped your actual neck, and you're in a time loop so even if they did it wouldn't matter, but still! Wow!
<color=grey>Sigh...</color><Pause/> Well, it just goes to show you, not everyone is going to be your friend. Tough lesson, but it's the truth.
Whoa! How'd you do that?

DialogueOption.Text: I just flew out of range of it.
I was on the Stranger.
I was, umm... out of range. It's a long story.
I was inside the Ash Twin Project.
Dunno. It just kind of... happened.

Dialogue.Page: I guess that'd do it, yeah. It's a shame every other star system is too far away to fly to.
It's that far away? ...Wait, but that doesn't make any sense, it has to be between the sun and the map satellite, right? That's how it caused that shadow.
Hmm. Something doesn't add up there.
Right, you're safe from the supernova in there. Cool! Kinda pointless I guess, but cool!
Hmm. Well, alright then.
Guess you'll have to go out and die in some more creative ways then, huh? Have fun!
I see.<Pause=1> That's quite the ambitious goal, time bud.
And I think you're absolutely gonna be able to do it.
I'll be here, rooting for you, just like always. Don't feel bad for me; I'm ready to die. Especially if it's for something like this.
Go make the Nomai proud, friend.
I see.<Pause=1> That's quite the ambitious goal, time bud.
And I think you're absolutely gonna be able to do it. Just don't chicken out this time, okay?
I'll be here, rooting for you, just like always. Don't feel bad for me; I'm ready to die. Especially if it's for something like this.
Go make the Nomai proud, friend.
…Oh.<Pause=1> Really?<Pause=1> …Huh.
You know, I…<Pause=1> I kind of thought I'd have a stronger reaction to that, but honestly, I just…
…I mean, we're not gonna be able to stop the sun from exploding, are we? So…<Pause=1> what would be the point of even continuing the loop?
We could live forever like this…<Pause=1> but it'd only be us who would know it. And we wouldn't be able to do anything of any actual consequence.
We could spend the whole loop building something up just for it to get knocked down. What kind of existence is that?
I've had time to think all of this over. Heck, thinking things over is pretty much all that I've been doing.
And I think I've come to my conclusion:<Pause=1> I'm ready to die.
But if you're not…<Pause=1> you could always go and turn it back on. If there's even possible, and if there's still time, that is.
The choice is yours. But just know that if you choose to leave things like this, I'm at peace about it.
…Oh.<Pause=1> Really?<Pause=1> …Huh.
You know, I…<Pause=1> I kind of thought I'd have a stronger reaction to that, but honestly, I just…
…I mean, we're not gonna be able to stop the sun from exploding, are we? So…<Pause=1> what would be the point of even continuing the loop?
We could live forever like this…<Pause=1> but it'd only be us who would know it. And we wouldn't be able to do anything of any actual consequence.
We could spend the whole loop building something up just for it to get knocked down. What kind of existence is that?
I've had time to think all of this over. Heck, thinking things over is pretty much all that I've been doing.
And I think I've come to my conclusion:<Pause=1> I'm ready to die.
But if you're not…<Pause=1> you could always go and put that thing back. If there's even still time, that is.
The choice is yours. But just know that if you choose to leave things like this, I'm at peace about it.
Alright, time buddy. Then I'm gonna drift off again.
Whoa! Thanks there, time bud. It gets kinda lonely out here sometimes.
…Hello again.
I guess you changed your mind.<Pause=1> That's okay.
What's up?
…Hey.
Alright. I may have overreacted a little there. Or maybe not? I'm… really not sure how I feel about all this.
Anyways, umm… what's going on with you?
What’s up?
…Hello again.
I guess you changed your mind.<Pause=1> That's okay.
What's up?
What’s up?
…Ah, I see you brought that thing with you again. Keeping your promise this time?
Heh. Don't answer that, time bud. I'm perfectly alright with either outcome.
Hey, time buddy. Still sticking by your choice?
Well, either way, I think…<Pause=1> I think I'm gonna close my eyes for the rest of this one. You're welcome to lay here next to me, bud.
It's been…<Pause=1> really great being with you. I couldn't've wished for a better partner in time.
Hey, time buddy. I see you're sticking by your choice.
I think…<Pause=1> I think I'm gonna close my eyes for the rest of it. You're welcome to lay here next to me, bud.
It's been…<Pause=1> really great being with you. I couldn't've wished for a better partner in time.
Hey, time buddy. Still sticking by your choice?
Well, either way, I think…<Pause=1> I think I'm gonna close my eyes for the rest of this one.
It's been…<Pause=1> really great being with you. I couldn't've wished for a better partner in time.

DialogueOption.Text: My ship's completely busted.
I totalled my ship again.

Dialogue.Page: Ha! Nice. It must be fun doing that without having to worry about the consequences.
I wonder how far you could eject yourself into space? No reason not to push that big red button anymore, right?
